intro: Galium davuricum f. tokyoense, commonly known as Japanese bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in umbels, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional herbal remedies due to its mild medicinal properties.
